explanations: When we multiply a number by 100, we add two zeroes to the right of the original number. This is because 100 is a two-digit number, so when we multiply by it, we are essentially multiplying by 10 twice, which adds two zeroes.

details.choice_question:
Question: When we multiply a number by 100, what do we add to the right of the original number?
A. One zero
B. Two zeroes
C. Three zeroes
D. Four zeroes
